meanings.definition: serving to present or bring to notice
meanings.sent1: The colorful poster was a presentative display at the school fair.
meanings.sent2: The bright lights on the stage created a presentative atmosphere for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The presentative balloons caught everyone's attention at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as presentative as a spotlight on a dark stage.
meanings.sent5: The presenter's confident voice was truly presentative during the speech.

meanings.definition: a person who presents something to another person
meanings.sent1: The presenter handed the award to the winner, acting as the presentative of the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson was a helpful presentative in assisting customers with their purchases.
meanings.sent3: The presentative of the new product launch was dressed in a funny costume.
meanings.sent4: She was a presentative of kindness, always willing to help those in need.
meanings.sent5: The presentative greeted guests with a warm smile and welcoming words.
